title: Gael Greene, Who Shook Up Restaurant Reviewing, Dies at 88
description: She brought sass and sensuality to the job as a critic for New York magazine for four decades. She also helped create the charity Citymeals on Wheels.
dc:creator: William Grimes
media:description: Gael Greene in 1971, three years after Clay Felker hired her to be his new magazine’s restaurant critic, a role she had never had before. “I felt that I was an impostor,” she said.
